etymologies: mid 17th century: from obsolete Italian profilo, from the verb profilare, from pro- ‘forth’ + filare ‘to spin’, formerly ‘draw a line’ (from Latin filare, from filum ‘thread’)

definitions: an outline of something, especially a person's face, as seen from one side

examples.text: the man turned and she caught his profile

definitions: a vertical cross section of a structure

examples.text: skillfully made vessels with an S-shaped profile

definitions: an outline of part of the earth's surface, e.g. the course of a river, as seen in a vertical section.
shortDefinitions: outline of part of earth's surface

definitions: a flat piece of scenery or stage property that has been cut so as to form an outline or silhouette of an object.
a short article giving a description of a person or organization

examples.text: a profile of a Texas tycoon

definitions: (on a social media website or application) a user's summary of their personal details or current situation

examples.text: he posted the pictures on his Facebook profile

shortDefinitions: (on social media website) user's summary of personal details or current situation

definitions: the extent to which a person or organization attracts public notice

examples.text: raising the profile of women in industry

shortDefinitions: extent to which person attracts notice

definitions: a graphical or other representation of information relating to particular characteristics of something, recorded in quantified form

examples.text: the blood profiles of cancer patients

shortDefinitions: representation of information in quantified form

definitions: a record of a person's psychological or behavioral characteristics, preferences, etc.

examples.text: they had been using personal details to build customer profiles

shortDefinitions: record of person's psychological or behavioural characteristics

definitions: describe (a person or organization, especially a public figure) in a short article

examples.text: he was to profile each candidate

definitions: represent in outline from one side

examples.text: he was standing motionless, profiled on the far side of the swimming pool

definitions: have a specified shape or appearance in outline

examples.text: a proud bird profiled like a phoenix

definitions: shape (something), especially by means of a tool guided by a template

examples.text: I use my angle grinder all the time for profiling tiles
